snippet: But the military judge in the case said that the conditions under which the former Army intelligence analyst Pfc. Bradley E. Manning was held were improperly harsh at times.
abstract: Military Judge Col Denise Lind declines to dismiss charges against Pfc Bradley E Manning, former Army intelligence analyst accused of providing classified information to antisecrecy group WikiLeaks, despite his claims of mistreatment in detention.
lead_paragraph: But the military judge in the case said that the conditions under which the former Army intelligence analyst Pfc. Bradley E. Manning was held were improperly harsh at times.

headline.seo: Private Manning of WikiLeaks Case Must Face Charges
headline.main: Judge Says Harsh Detention Is Not Cause to Drop Charges in WikiLeaks Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Says Harsh Detention Is Not Cause to Drop Charges in WikiLeaks Case

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
